zone.line: And paved with veined emerald, & a fountain
Leaps in the midst with an awakening sound;
From its curved roof the mountain's frozen tears 150
Like snow or silver or long diamond spires
Hang downward, raining down forth a doubtful light;
And there is heard the ever-moving air
Whispering without from tree to tree, & birds,
And bees; and all around are mossy seats
And the rough walls are clothed with long soft
grass
A simple dwelling, which shall be our own
Where we will sit & talk of time & change
As the world ebbs & flows, ourselves unchanged—
For What can hide man from Mutability?— 160
And ^if ye sigh, then I will smile, & thou
Ione, shall chant fragments of sea-music ,
Until I weep, when ye shall smile away
The tears she brought, which yet were sweet to
shed;
We will entangle buds & flowers, & make
Strange combinations out of common things
Like human babes in their brief innocence
And we will search, with looks & words of love
